fields.name: FT Diameter Field
fields.description: Longest diameter of the plant measured on the day the first flower was observed

fields.name: Leaf serr 16
fields.description: Average severity of serration across 4 plants was scored between 0 (entire lamina) and 1.5 (jagged serration) after 5 weeks of growth

fields.name: Seed bank 133-91
fields.description: Genotypes consistently decreased their percentage of germination between 91 and 133 days of dry storage. The time point for this sudden reduction in germination rate was scored by the slope between germination percentages at these two time points

fields.name: Na23
fields.description: Sodium concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: Leaf serr 10
fields.description: Average severity of serration across 4 plants was scored between 0 (entire lamina) and 1.5 (jagged serration) after 8 weeks of growth

fields.name: Emco5
fields.description: All interactions were scored specifically on first true leaves as compatible, incompatible or intermediate depending on the consistency of presence / absence of sporangiophores determined on 5-10 seedlings of each genotype with three independent replications

fields.name: Leaf roll 16
fields.description: Results expressed as binary data, determined by the presence (1) or absence (0) of rolled leaves in all 4 plants / accession at 5 weeks growth

fields.name: Leaf roll 10
fields.description: Results expressed as binary data, determined by the presence (1) or absence (0) of rolled leaves in all 4 plants / accession at 8 weeks growth

fields.name: Bs
fields.description: Four days after inoculation, leaves were scored by eye for disease symptom using a scale from 0 (no visible symptom) to 10 (leaves collapse and turn yellow), with an increment of 1.

fields.name: 2W
fields.description: Number of days required for the bolt height to reach 5cm

fields.name: Rosette Erect 22
fields.description: (22°C was the only temperature at which this phenotype was frequently observed). Results were expressed as binary data, determined by the central rosette being erect (1) or not (0) in all 4 plants / accession phenotyped at 5 weeks post germination

fields.name: Cd114
fields.description: Cadmium concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: Width 16
fields.description: The diameters of 4 plants of each accession were measured and the results were expressed as an average value across all available replicates.Plants were scored 5 weeks post germination

fields.name: Storage 28 days
fields.description: Primary dormancy was measured as the progressive increase of germination rate measured after 28 days of dry storage

fields.name: LY
fields.description: Presence of lesioning and yellowing.

fields.name: avrRpm1
fields.description: Following inoculation of two leaves per plant with 0.1 ml of 10 -8 cfu/ml bacteria in 10 mM MgSO4 buffer using a blunt-tipped syringe, leaf collapse was scored at 20 hrs and again at 24 hrs after inoculation. A positive score at either time point was deemed a hypersensitive response

fields.name: Width 10
fields.description: The diameters of 4 plants of each accession were measured and the results were expressed as an average value across all available replicates.Plants were scored 8 weeks post germination

fields.name: Chlorosis 22
fields.description: Results expressed as binary data, determined by the presence (1) or absence (0) of chlorosis in all 4 plants / accession after 5wks of growth

fields.name: Storage 7 days
fields.description: Primary dormancy was measured as the progressive increase of germination rate measured after 7 days of dry storage

fields.name: Co59
fields.description: Cobalt concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: FW
fields.description: Lesioning measured by fresh weight

fields.name: Cu65
fields.description: Copper concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: Bacterial titer
fields.description: Following inoculation into leaf  tissues, the titers of bacteria were measured at 0 and 4 days. Bacterial titres were measured from hole-punched leaf disks ground in 200μL of 10 mM MgSO4. Measurements were expressed as colony forming units per unit area and replicated in triplicate.

fields.name: Width 22
fields.description: The diameters of 4 plants of each accession were measured and the results were expressed as an average value across all available replicates.Plants were scored 5 weeks post germination

fields.name: Storage 56 days
fields.description: Primary dormancy was measured as the progressive increase of germination rate measured after 56 days of dry storage

fields.name: YEL
fields.description: Yellowing is a precocious,more diffused leaf chlorosis.Accessions were divided in three subgroups (mild, intermediate and severe) according to the severity of the yellowing.

fields.name: FLC
fields.description: RNA was extracted from leaves after 4 wks of growth. FLC gene expression levels were determined by Northern hybridization quantified relative to $Beta;-TUBULIN expression

fields.name: FT16
fields.description: Plants were checked bi-weekly for presence of first buds, and the average flowering time of 4 plants of the same accession were collected

fields.name: FT10
fields.description: Plants were checked bi-weekly for presence of first buds, and the average flowering time of 4 plants of the same accession were collected

fields.name: FT Duration GH
fields.description: Number of days between appearance of the first flower and the senescence of the last flower

fields.name: Se82
fields.description: Selenium concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: LDV
fields.description: Number of days to flowering under long days after 4 weeks vernalization.  Seeds were stratified, and days we counted from the end of stratification. The experiment was stopped at 200 d, and accessions that had not flowered at that point were assigned a value of 200

fields.name: Noco2
fields.description: All interactions were scored specifically on first true leaves as compatible, incompatible or intermediate depending on the consistency of presence / absence of sporangiophores determined on 5-10 seedlings of each genotype with three independent replications

fields.name: 8W GH LN
fields.description: Leaf number was scored as the number of rosette leaves and the number of cauline leaves when the bolt reached 5cm

fields.name: 0W
fields.description: Number of days required for the bolt height to reach 5cm

fields.name: MT GH
fields.description: Number of days between last flower senescence and complete plant senescence

fields.name: After Vern Growth
fields.description: Vegetative growth rate after vernalization was estimated as the increment of cm<SUP>2</SUP> leaf area per day between each of the three time points for which leaf area was measured

fields.name: Aphid number
fields.description: On day 25 of growth,two alate females of the common peach aphid, Myzus persicae,were placed on each of four plants of each of the 96 genotypes. Nine days later, the number of offspring produced by these aphids on each plant was recorded.

fields.name: LN22
fields.description: Plants were checked bi-weekly for presence of first buds, and the average leaf number at flowering time of 4 plants of the same accession were collected

fields.name: Bs CFU2
fields.description: In planta bacterial growth (number of CFU / leaf area) of the P. viridiflava strain was individually measured as described in Goss and Bergelson 2006

fields.name: avrRpt2
fields.description: Following inoculation of two leaves per plant with 0.1 ml of 10 -8 cfu/ml bacteria in 10 mM MgSO4 buffer using a blunt-tipped syringe, leaf collapse was scored at 20 hrs and again at 24 hrs after inoculation. A positive score at either time point was deemed a hypersensitive response

fields.name: Hypocotyl length
fields.description: After seven days growth under the photocycle and thermocycle treatment,plants were flattened directly on the agar and imaged on a flatbed scanner. Hypocotyl lengths were determined using NIH Image

fields.name: Germ 22
fields.description: Days to germination of each accession were recorded daily at each temperature upon first emergence of cotyledons

fields.name: Leaf roll 22
fields.description: Results expressed as binary data, determined by the presence (1) or absence (0) of rolled leaves in all 4 plants / accession at 5 weeks growth

fields.name: SD
fields.description: Number of days following stratification to opening of first flower. The experiment was stopped at 200 d, and accessions that had not flowered at that point were assigned a value of 200

fields.name: 8W
fields.description: Number of days required for the bolt height to reach 5cm

fields.name: FT GH
fields.description: Flowering time was scored as the number of days between germination date and appearance of the first flower

fields.name: DSDS50
fields.description: Number of days of seed dry storage required to reach 50% germination, or DSDS50 value (Alonso-Blanco et al., 2003)

fields.name: Ca43
fields.description: Calcium concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: LC Duration GH
fields.description: Number of days between germination and plant complete senescence

fields.name: 0W GH FT
fields.description: Flowering time was scored as the number of days for the bolt to reach 5cm

fields.name: B11
fields.description: Boron concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: Chlorosis 10
fields.description: Results expressed as binary data, determined by the presence (1) or absence (0) of chlorosis in all 4 plants / accession after 8wks of growth

fields.name: RP GH
fields.description: Reproduction period: number of days between the appearance of the first flower and the plant complete senescence

fields.name: Chlorosis 16
fields.description: Results expressed as binary data, determined by the presence (1) or absence (0) of chlorosis in all 4 plants / accession after 5wks of growth

fields.name: LFS GH
fields.description: Number of days between germination and senescence of the last flower

fields.name: Germ 10
fields.description: Days to germination of each accession were recorded daily at each temperature upon first emergence of cotyledons

fields.name: Germ 16
fields.description: Days to germination of each accession were recorded daily at each temperature upon first emergence of cotyledons

fields.name: Anthocyanin 16
fields.description: Results expressed as binary data, determined by the presence (1) or absence (0) of anthocyanin in all 4 plants / accession after 5wks of growth

fields.name: Anthocyanin 10
fields.description: Results expressed as binary data, determined by the presence (1) or absence (0) of anthocyanin in all 4 plants / accession after 8wks of growth

fields.name: Ni60
fields.description: Nickel concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: P31
fields.description: Phosphorus concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: Emwa1
fields.description: All interactions were scored specifically on first true leaves as compatible, incompatible or intermediate depending on the consistency of presence / absence of sporangiophores determined on 5-10 seedlings of each genotype with three independent replications

fields.name: As75
fields.description: Arsenic concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: Germ in dark
fields.description: The ability to germinate in the dark at 4°C was measured as the percentage of non dormant seeds that can germinate during 1-week long cold exposure, in the absence of light

fields.name: FRI
fields.description: RNA was extracted from leaves after 4 wks of growth. FRI gene expression levels were determined by Northern hybridization quantified relative to $Beta;-TUBULIN expression

fields.name: Trichome avg C
fields.description: Measurements were collected from leaf disks removed from the 11th leaf of plants that had been treated with 0.6ml of a water control (C). Trichome density was calculated as the trichome number per disk divided by the disk area

fields.name: Vern Growth
fields.description: Vegetative growth rate during vernalization was estimated as the increment of cm<SUP>2</SUP> leaf area per day between each of the three time points for which leaf area was measured

fields.name: Mo98
fields.description: Molybdenum concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: Hiks1
fields.description: All interactions were scored specifically on first true leaves as compatible, incompatible or intermediate depending on the consistency of presence / absence of sporangiophores determined on 5-10 seedlings of each genotype with three independent replications

fields.name: Anthocyanin 22
fields.description: Results expressed as binary data, determined by the presence (1) or absence (0) of anthocyanin in all 4 plants / accession after 5wks of growth

fields.name: Zn66
fields.description: Zinc concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: Trichome avg JA
fields.description: Measurements were collected from leaf disks removed from the 11th leaf of plants that had been treated with 0.6 ml of a 0.45mM solution of jasmonic acid (Sigma J-2500) in water (JA). Trichome density was calculated as the trichome number per disk divided by the disk area

fields.name: LES
fields.description: Lesioning is the presence in older leaves of necrotic spots, that spread to the whole leaf. Lesioned accessions were divided in three subgroups (mild, intermediate and severe) according to the severity of lesioning

fields.name: Silique 16
fields.description: The length of 5 siliques was measured for each accession after growth had concluded

fields.name: Emoy*
fields.description: All interactions were scored specifically on first true leaves as compatible, incompatible or intermediate depending on the consistency of presence / absence of sporangiophores determined on 5-10 seedlings of each genotype with three independent replications

fields.name: K39
fields.description: Potassium concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: 0W GH LN
fields.description: Leaf number was scored as the number of rosette leaves and the number of cauline leaves when the bolt reached 5cm

fields.name: LN10
fields.description: Plants were checked bi-weekly for presence of first buds, and the average leaf number at flowering time of 4 plants of the same accession were collected

fields.name: FT Field
fields.description: Flowering time was scored as the number of days between germination date and appearance of the first flower

fields.name: LN16
fields.description: Plants were checked bi-weekly for presence of first buds, and the average leaf number at flowering time of 4 plants of the same accession were collected

fields.name: avrB
fields.description: Following inoculation of two leaves per plant with 0.1 ml of 10 -8 cfu/ml bacteria in 10 mM MgSO4 buffer using a blunt-tipped syringe, leaf collapse was scored at 20 hrs and again at 24 hrs after inoculation. A positive score at either time point was deemed a hypersensitive response

fields.name: LD
fields.description: Number of days following stratification to opening of first flower. The experiment was stopped at 200 d, and accessions that had not flowered at that point were assigned a value of 200

fields.name: Seedling Growth
fields.description: Seedling growth rate was given by leaf area  divided by the number of days of growth since sowing ( in cm<SUP>2</SUP>/day)

fields.name: S34
fields.description: Sulfur concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: Leaf serr 22
fields.description: Average severity of serration across 4 plants was scored between 0 (entire lamina) and 1.5 (jagged serration) after 5 weeks of growth

fields.name: DW
fields.description: Lesioning measured by dry weight

fields.name: Seed Dormancy
fields.description: Number of days of seed dry storage required to reach 50&#37 germination, or DSDS50 value (Alonso-Blanco et al., 2003). The measurement for each genotype was calculated as the average value across all available replicates

fields.name: Mn55
fields.description: Manganese concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: Silique 22
fields.description: The length of 5 siliques was measured for each accession after growth had concluded

fields.name: avrPphB
fields.description: Following inoculation of two leaves per plant with 0.1 ml of 10 -8 cfu/ml bacteria in 10 mM MgSO4 buffer using a blunt-tipped syringe, leaf collapse was scored at 20 hrs and again at 24 hrs after inoculation. A positive score at either time point was deemed a hypersensitive response

fields.name: Fe56
fields.description: Iron concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: 8W GH FT
fields.description: Flowering time was scored as the number of days for the bolt to reach 5cm

fields.name: 4W
fields.description: Number of days required for the bolt height to reach 5cm

fields.name: Li7
fields.description: Lithium concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: FT22
fields.description: Plants were checked bi-weekly for presence of first buds, and the average flowering time of 4 plants of the same accession were collected

fields.name: SDV
fields.description: Number of days following stratification to opening of first flower. The experiment was stopped at 200 d, and accessions that had not flowered at that point were assigned a value of 200

fields.name: Mg25
fields.description: Magnesium concentrations in leaves, grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al., 2008

fields.name: Secondary Dormancy
fields.description: Secondary dormancy was given by the slope between the germination percentages of non-dormant seeds after one and six weeks of cold treatment. Viability of non germinating seeds after cold treatment was confirmed as described in Cadman et al., 2006

fields.name: As
fields.description: Four days after inoculation, leaves were scored by eye for disease symptom using a scale from 0 (no visible symptom) to 10 (leaves collapse and turn yellow), with an increment of 1.
